text.0: drink soma lord of bays and let it cheer thee indra the stone like a well guided courser.
text.1: directed by the pressers arms hath pressed it.
text.2: so let the draught of joy thy dear companion by which o lord of bays thou slayest foemen.
text.3: delight thee indra lord of princely treasures.
text.4: mark closely maghavan the words i utter this eulogy recited by vasiṣṭha.
text.5: accept the prayers i offer at thy banquet.
text.6: hear thou the call of the juicedrinking pressstone hear thou the brahmans hymn who sings and lauds thee.
text.7: take to thine inmost self these adorations.
text.8: i know and neer forget the hymns and praises of thee the conqueror and thy strength immortal.
text.9: thy name i ever utter selfrefulgent.
text.10: among mankind many are thy libations and many a time the pious sageinvokes thee.
text.11: o maghavan be not long distant from us.
text.12: all these libations are for thee o hero to thee i offer these my prayers that strengthen.
text.13: ever in every place must men invoke thee.
text.14: never do men attain o wonderworker thy greatness mighty one who must be lauded.
text.15: nor indra thine heroic power and bounty.
text.16: among all Ṛṣis indra old and recent who have engendered hymns as sacred singers.
text.17: even with us be thine auspicious friendships ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
